business.headline: India's poverty rate sees sharp decline, falls to 5.3% in 2022-23India's updated consumption data helped offset the World Bank's revised International Poverty Line, reducing the global increase in extreme poverty by 125 million people.

Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence from telecom ministryElon Musk's Starlink has received a crucial licence from India's telecom ministry, paving the way for its satellite internet services in the country.
Elon Musk's Starlink gets licence to launch in India: ReportStarlink had applied for the licence back in 2022, but the process was delayed due to various concerns, including national security.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty goes past 25,000; Bajaj Finance gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 746.95 points to end at 82,188.99, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 252.15 points to close at 25,003.05.

US doubles steel, aluminium tariff: Is it a big worry for India?The tariff hike does not apply to all countries. The United Kingdom has been excluded because of a trade agreement already in place with the US.
RBI rate cut may hurt FDs. Here's what investors should do nowBanks have already begun adjusting their FD rates downward following the RBI's earlier moves since February 2025.

Elon Musk thought he could play politics. Now Tesla's paying the priceElon Musk's fallout with Donald Trump cost Tesla $150 billion in a day. His gamble with power seems to be backfiring fast, and the fallout could reach far beyond the stock market.

Explained: What does the RBI mean by front-loading the rate cutThe RBI's latest rate cut is being called a "front-loaded" rate cut, meaning the central bank is cutting interest rates earlier and by a bigger margin than usual.

RBI's big CRR boost: What it means for banks and youIf you're eyeing a home loan, car loan, or personal loan, this development could work in your favour. With banks gaining access to more funds, interest rates on loans are likely to drop, which means your monthly EMIs could reduce.

RBI cuts repo rate again: 5 key takeaways you must knowSince February 2025, the RBI has slashed the repo rate by a full 100 basis points. With this sharp reduction, it believes there's now less room left to cut rates further to support growth. So, the RBI has changed its policy stance from "accommodative" to "neutral".

RBI slashes repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, third consecutive cutThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, marking the third consecutive rate cut. This decision comes amid a sharp drop in retail inflation to 3.16% in April and strong economic growth of 7.4% in the January-March quarter. The move is expected to make loans cheaper, benefiting borrowers, especially home buyers. The RBI has also changed its stance from accommodative to neutral, indicating a data-driven approach moving forward.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why RBI's bumper rate cut has Dalal Street buzzingStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 731.61 points to 82,173.65, while the NSE Nifty rallied by 236.30 points to 24,987.20 as of 11:21 am.

RBI's bumper rate cut to lower home, auto loan EMIs: What it means for youThe decision was announced after RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra and the six-member Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) wrapped up their three-day review on Friday. This is the third consecutive rate cut, following back-to-back reductions earlier this year, including a 25-basis point cut in April.

RBI slashes key lending rate for 3rd consecutive time, brings it down to 5.5%The decision was announced after the central bank's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, concluded its three-day meeting that began on June 4.
Sensex down over 200 points, Nifty below 24,800; Tata Steel gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.18 points to 81,244.86, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 50.70 points to 24,700.20 as of 9:55 am.

Sensex and Nifty likely to rise on RBI rate cut hopesAnalysts predict a rate cut in RBI's MPC announcement. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,849.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that Nifty50 will open above Thursday's close of 24,750.90.
Stocks to watch on June 6 as RBI rate cut anticipatedInvestors will have several stocks in focus as the Reserve Bank of India is expected to announce a rate cut, potentially boosting the market.

Tesla's worst day ever: $152 billion wiped out after Musk-Trump falloutTesla's market capitalisation fell below the $1 trillion mark and ended the day at $916 billion, its biggest single-day loss in value ever.

Tesla shares fall 14% as Musk-Trump feud rattles investorsTesla shares plunged 14% as the Elon Musk–Donald Trump bromance ended and their feud spilled into the open, wiping out $150 billion in market value and weighing on Wall Street despite optimism over tariff talks.

India could become third largest economy in the world this year: Borge BrendeIn an exclusive interview with India Today, World Economic Forum President and CEO Borge Brende talked about India's strong economic performance and projected it could become the world's third-largest economy this year.

Tariffs, wars, AI: WEF chief breaks down what's next for global economyFrom rising tariffs and geopolitical risks to AI-driven productivity leaps, WEF CEO Borge Brende reveals how resilience, innovation, and cautious optimism could shape the future of the global economy beyond 2025

India is world's bright spot, set to overtake Japan: WEF chief Borge BrendeWEF CEO Borge Brende said India is the world's bright spot but added that to stay ahead, it must double down on reforms, infrastructure, and coordination across states.

Delhi Airport gives seed balls to flyers, merges green goals with social impactLed by GMR Aero's Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the campaign invites passengers to plant seed balls containing species like Lemon, Tamarind, Gooseberry, Neem, and Peepal, all chosen for their ecological and medicinal value.
Want to update your credit card email? Follow these stepsA guide to updating your registered email address for credit cards in India, highlighting the new RBI KYC norms and simplification by banks.

Tata to handle iPhone and MacBook repairs in India for Apple: ReportAs the US tech giant continues to diversify its manufacturing footprint beyond China, Tata has emerged as a key ally. The group already assembles iPhones at three facilities in southern India, with one also manufacturing certain components.
Will energy replace currency? Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath thinks soNikhil Kamath believes energy could replace money in the next decade. Here's why he thinks so.

Sensex ends over 400 points higher, Nifty above 24,700; Eternal gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 443.79 points to end at 81,442.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 130.70 points to close at 24,750.90.

Want ELI scheme benefits? Make sure your UAN and Aadhaar are linked by this dateThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has extended the deadline for UAN activation and Aadhaar linking to bank accounts under the ELI scheme until 30 June 2025.

Are you a freelancer? 5 things to know while filing your ITRFreelancers can claim deductions for expenses directly related to their work. These include internet bills, rent for a co-working space, cost of software tools, professional fees, marketing and advertising costs, and travel expenses related to business, etc.

GST Council may remove 12% slab, shift items to 5% and 18% tax ratesThe GST Council is considering eliminating the 12% tax slab as part of efforts to streamline the tax structure, potentially moving these items to either the 5% or 18% brackets.

Dr Reddy's shares jump over 3% today. Here's whyDr Reddy's shares soar 3.54% after Alvotech partnership for Keytruda biosimilar, enhancing global reach in cancer immunotherapy and signaling growth potential in competitive biosimilar market.
What is DIGIPIN? India's new digital address system explainedThe Department of Posts has launched DIGIPIN, a geocoded digital address system aiming to improve location accuracy and service delivery.

Eternal shares continue to rally, jumps over 4%. Should you buy?By approximately 10:06 am, the company's shares had risen 4.42% to Rs 256.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). This marks a 12% rise over the past five trading sessions and a 6% increase over the past month. However, year-to-date, the stock remains down by over 7%.
Sensex rallies 800 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 12:24 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had jumped 770.31 points to reach 81,768.56. The NSE Nifty50 was also up by 230.50 points at 24,850.60.
Sensex, Nifty rise as RBI rate cut hopes lift market; pharma stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 273 points to 81,271.25, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 86.55 points to 24,706.75 as of 9:29 am.
Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to rally today? Check key levelsGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,733.5 as of 8:00 am, signalling a strong start above Nifty50's previous close of 24,620.2.

Stocks to watch on June 5: Reliance Infra, Yes Bank, BEL, HAL, REC, Power GridAn overview of stock movements on Dalal Street today, including updates on Adani Airports, Reliance Infrastructure, and more.

Volkswagen to trim 35,000 jobs in Germany by 2030Volkswagen is planning to cut 35,000 jobs in Germany by the year 2030. To make the transition easier, Volkswagen is preparing severance packages for affected employees.
Sensex ends 261 points higher; Nifty above 24,600; Eternal gains over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 261 points to end at 80,998.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 77.70 points to close at 24,620.20.

Government seeks lower energy costs for backing green steel incentives: ReportIndia's finance ministry calls for lower energy prices to facilitate incentives for green steel production, amidst concerns over high green hydrogen costs and inflation.

entertainment.headline: Kapil Sharma, Shankar Mahadevan light up Aamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par bashKapil Sharma shared a joyous glimpse of a private musical evening at Aamir Khan's residence, celebrating the upcoming release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' with friends and celebrities. The event featured soulful performances and star-studded guests, including Sachin Tendulkar.

Eid-al-Adha 2025: Salman Khan, Allu Arjun and celebs wish fans Eid MubarakOn the occasion of Eid-al-Adha 2025, Bollywood celebrities including Salman Khan, Kamal Haasan and Allu Arjun, among others, extended wishes to their fans. Take a look at the list.

Miley Cyrus still into ex Nick Jonas, admits being distraught after breakupMiley Cyrus opened up about her past relationship with Nick Jonas, revealing that she was deeply distraught after their breakup and struggled to move on.

Actor Jamie Lever recalls being sexually harassed during school and collegeActor Jamie Lever has shared her personal experiences of sexual harassment during her school and college years. She revealed how these incidents traumatised her and stayed with her for a long time before she found the courage to speak out.

Rana Daggubati discusses work-life balance amid Deepika Padukone-Sandeep Reddy rowDeepika Padukone walked out of Sandeep Vanga's 'Spirit' citing long working hours and contract issues, igniting a wider discussion on labour practices in Indian cinema. Now, actor Rana Daggubati offered insights on balancing work culture in the industries.

Badshah says he wants to make babies with Dua Lipa, sparks online outrageRapper Badshah is facing backlash online following his comment about Albanian singer Dua Lipa. In a recent post on X, the rapper expressed his desire to "have babies with her," sparking widespread criticism and trolling.

Did Samantha remove her Ye Maaya Chesave tattoo linked to ex Naga Chaitanya?Fans were convinced that Samantha had removed all tattoos linked to her ex, Naga Chaitanya. However, her latest Instagram story - after a video showed the absence of her 'Ye Maaya Chesave' tattoo - suggested otherwise.

Ekta Kapoor collaborates with Netflix, fans say dhoom tana meets TudumNetflix and Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms have announced a long-term partnership to create fresh, culturally rooted content for streaming audiences. The collaboration was announced on Saturday, June 7th.

Case against filmmaker Manish Gupta for stabbing his driver over salary disputeFilmmaker Manish Gupta, known for directing films like 'One Friday Night' and '420 IPC', has been detained for allegedly stabbing his driver following a dispute over salary. The complaint was registered at the Versova Police Station.

Jamiee Lee Curtis, Lindsay Lohan's Freakier Friday eyes August release in IndiaThe trailer for 'Freakier Friday' has been released in India, featuring Lindsay Lohan and Jamie Lee Curtis reprising their roles from the 2003 hit. This time, the body-swapping chaos extends beyond mother and daughter duo to the next generation as well.

Deepika Padukone joins Allu Arjun for Atlee's sci-fi action film AA22xA6Deepika Padukone has joined Atlee and Allu Arjun's upcoming film 'AA22xA6'. The makers announced the news on Jun 7 with a special video.

TV's leading ladies take the lead in pay parity battleFrom Tulsi to Anupamaa, television's leading ladies aren't just winning hearts, they're rewriting the rules of the game. From topping the TRP and remuneration list, read how women have brought revolution with their popularity.

Shoaib Ibrahim shares Dipika Kakar's health update, says she is stable, out of ICUActor Dipika Kakar underwent a 14-hour surgery for stage 2 liver cancer and is now out of the ICU, confirmed husband-actor Shoaib Ibrahim. He shared that her condition is improving and thanked fans for their prayers during this difficult time.

Thug Life box office Day 2: Kamal Haasan's film sees sharp drop, earns Rs 7.5 croreKamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' saw a sharp drop at the box office on Day 2, earning Rs 7.5 crore nett across all languages. The film performed well in Tamil Nadu but struggled in Hindi and Telugu markets, with no release in Karnataka affecting its overall reach.

Housefull 5 box office Day 1: Akshay Kumar's film surpasses Fighter on opening dayAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' had a strong opening at the box office, earning Rs 23 crore nett on Day 1. It outperformed 'Sky Force', 'Fighter', and even the previous instalment 'Housefull 4' in first-day collections.

Aamir Khan hosts Sitaare Zameen Par musical night, Ranbir Kapoor, Kiran Rao attendAamir Khan recently hosted a starry musical evening to celebrate his upcoming film 'Sitaare Zameen Par', featuring debut actors and surprise guest Ranbir Kapoor. The film, a spiritual successor to 'Taare Zameen Par', introduces fresh talent and promises an emotional, heartfelt story.

Hina-Rocky's emotional wedding vows have promise of universe amid uncertaintiesHina Khan shared a heartwarming video of her wedding vows with husband Rocky Jaiswal. The couple got married on June 4, 2025.

Shweta Tripathi on turning producer with Cock: I am hungry to act, not greedyActor Shweta Tripathi has turned producer with her banner, AllMyTea Productions. In an interview with India Today, she speaks about backing the queer-themed play 'Cock' and portrayal of LGBTQI+ community in cinema.

Aamir Khan reveals his mother will make her debut in Sitaare Zameen ParBollywood superstar Aamir Khan recently broke the news about his mother Zeenat Khan's guest appearance in RS Prasanna's 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. This is the first time Zeenat will be seen in his film.

general news.headline: Release voter rolls, CCTV footage: Rahul Gandhi pushes poll panel for transparencyRahul Gandhi's push comes amidst an ongoing back-and-forth with the poll panel, which has dismissed his allegations of "match-fixing" in the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

Stampede victims' families to get Rs 25 lakh: Karnataka increases aid amountThis is in addition to Rs 10 lakh compensation announced each for the families of the victims by the Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Feisty Gauff stuns Sabalenka to win maiden French Open crownFrench Open 2025: 21-year-old Coco Gauff beat World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter to claim her maiden Roland Garros title. It was also Gauff's second Grand Slam title after the US Open 2023, where she also got the better of Sabalenka in the final.

Learn to control your tongue: Goa minister loses cool at doctor, suspends himThe incident took place during a surprise visit by Vishwajit Rane to the GMCH premises on Saturday. The minister was reportedly reacting to a complaint received on his phone, alleging that a doctor was refusing to treat a patient and had misbehaved.

India's poverty rate sees sharp decline, falls to 5.3% in 2022-23India's updated consumption data helped offset the World Bank's revised International Poverty Line, reducing the global increase in extreme poverty by 125 million people.

Better to die than surrender: Criminal climbs 5th-floor ledge to evade copsThe criminal, identified as Abhishek alias 'Shooter', livestreamed the entire incident on social media, before he was rescued by firefighters and subsequently arrested by police.

Karnataka man beheads wife over affair, takes severed head to cops and surrendersThe accused, 28-year-old Shankar, a resident of Hennagara, reportedly committed the act after finding his wife in an intimate situation with another man at their rented house.

Parrots on bicycles, tigers in the ring, and a thousand claps: India's lost circus charmPopcorn, painted clowns, and the roar of lions -- once the highlight of a child's year, the circus was more than just a show. It was an event etched in the collective memory of Indian households. Until it quietly disappeared.

Trapped in Mussoorie traffic jam, 62-year-old man dies before reaching hospitalA 62-year-old tourist from Delhi, Kamal Kishore Tandon, died in Mussoorie after getting stuck in a traffic jam while being rushed to the hospital amid sudden illness and bad weather.

Pilot refuses takeoff, Eknath Shinde waits. Then, a life-saving twistFollowing a 45-minute-long closed-door discussion with ministers Girish Mahajan, Gulabrao Patil, and district administration officials trying to convince the pilot, the flight eventually took off. However, in a fated turn of events, Shinde's delayed arrival at Jalgaon airport turned out to be a boon for a woman who urgently needed to reach Mumbai for emergency kidney treatment.

Hope Elon comes back into fold: Vance calls feud with Trump huge mistake for MuskReacting to the public spat between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance said the tech titan made a huge mistake by getting involved in a war of words with the US President.

New CCTV clip, shirt clue deepen mystery around Indore couple's fateIn the CCTV footage, Sonam is seen taking off her jacket and fixing her hair. Moments later, Raja comes out, takes a few things out of the suitcase, and hands them over to Sonam. The white shirt Sonam is seen wearing in the CCTV footage was later found near Raja's body.

Elon Musk deletes post claiming Trump is named in Epstein filesTesla CEO Elon Musk deleted his X post, in which he accused US President Donald Trump of being named in the files of late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, hinting at a possible truce with his political ally-turned-foe.

Video: Helicopter makes emergency landing on Uttarakhand road, tail crushes carA private helicopter made an emergency landing in Uttarakhand due to a technical fault shortly after takeoff to Kedarnath. All passengers are safe; the pilot sustained minor injuries.

US teen dies after trying viral 'dusting' trend, parents warn othersA 19-year-old from Arizona died after attempting the viral 'dusting' trend, prompting her parents to speak out against the dangerous social media challenge.

When brain fog signals something more seriousA rising number of people report brain fog, a state of mental cloudiness affecting focus and memory. But it may signal deeper health issues needing timely attention.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Sinner vs Alcaraz French Open final set to be historic as big 3 era slowly endsJannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz are all set to create history at the French Open 2025 when they face off in the final on Sunday, June 8. Alcaraz will be aiming to defend his title while Sinner will look to claim his first crown at Roland Garros.

Raids, tear gas, arrests: Los Angeles streets erupt over immigration crackdownHundreds of protesters gathered outside the Los Angeles Federal Building condemning the immigration raids. During the standoff, some protesters hurled chunks of broken concrete at officers, who responded with tear gas, pepper spray and flash-bang grenades.

Lionel Messi coming to India? Kerala minister provides big updateKerala Sports Minister V Abdurahiman confirmed that Argentina football team led by Lionel Messi will visit Kerala for a friendly match in October or November 2025. The government will host the team as state guests.

Partners must understand India's zero-tolerance on terror: Jaishankar in UK talksThe comments come amid India's concern over some countries drawing parallels between India and Pakistan following their recent four-day military standoff.

Thackeray cousins patch-up buzz grows, MVA allies root for tie-upSpeculation is mounting over a potential reconciliation between estranged cousins Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray. NCP(SP) MP Supriya Sule welcomed the prospect of a reunion.

With over 1 million IT employees, Bengaluru is Asia-Pacific's top tech city: ReportBengaluru is now the top city in the Asia-Pacific region in terms of the highest number of IT professionals. Cities like New York, London, and San Francisco are also among those with the largest number of professionals in the IT sector.

It was also Gauff's second Grand Slam title after the US Open 2023, where she also got the better of Sabalenka in the final.

Yarraji, Shirse lead India to six-gold haul at Taiwan Open Athletics 2025India shone brightly at the Taiwan Open as Jyothi Yarraji led a six-gold medal haul, clocking 12.99 seconds in the 100m hurdles, while Tejas Shirse and both 4x100m relay teams added to the gold tally.

Cristiano Ronaldo shuts down FIFA Club World Cup talk amid transfer rumoursCristiano Ronaldo has ruled out participation in the FIFA Club World Cup despite offers from top clubs. As his Al-Nassr contract nears its end, the Portuguese star is focused on Portugal's Nations League final.

Ecclestone takes break from cricket for well-being before India seriesLeft-arm spinner Sophie Ecclestone took a break from domestic cricket to focus on her well-being before England's home ODI and T20I series against the West Indies.

Lionel Messi coming to India? Kerala minister provides big updateKerala Sports Minister V Abdurahiman confirmed that Argentina football team led by Lionel Messi will visit Kerala for a friendly match in October or November 2025. The government will host the team as state guests.

Cristiano Ronaldo only has praise for wonderkid Lamine Yamal: Let him growCristiano Ronaldo heaped praise on Spain's 17-year-old sensation Lamine Yamal ahead of the UEFA Nations League Final, calling for patience and support as the Barcelona starlet continues his rise on the international stage.

Final Highlights: Gauff makes comeback win to lift first Roland Garros titleFrench Open 2025 women's singles final Highlights: Coco Gauff has won her maiden Roland Garros title on top of a stupendous comeback win against Aryna Sabalenka by 6-7, 6-2, 6-4. After an intense first set went to Sabalenka, Gauff shifted gears to the top extent and dominatingly clinched her long-desired French Open title.

Lyon counting on Australia's big game experience vs SA in WTC FinalAustralia spinner Nathan Lyon is confident that his team's wealth of big-match experience will be crucial in the World Test Championship final against South Africa. The match promises a thrilling contest with South Africa aiming for their first ICC red-ball title under challenging English conditions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
